Claim: The mortality rate for the flu is “right around” that of the new coronavirus: “It’s right around 2%.”
Explaination: The mortality rate for the flu is considered by most experts to be about 0.1%. Estimates for the mortality rate for coronavirus are currently around 2%, but this number could change depending on how cases are diagnosed.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The mortality rate for the flu is “right around” that of the new coronavirus: “It’s right around 2%.”

Explanation:The mortality rate for the flu is considered by most experts to be about 0.1%. Estimates for the mortality rate for coronavirus are currently around 2%, but this number could change depending on how cases are diagnosed.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/02/chad-wolf/n-exchange-about-coronavirus-homeland-security-chi/

Claim: Donating blood in the U.S. can get you a novel coronavirus test.
Explaination: The two organizations who collect the vast majority of blood in US said they were not testing for COVID-19
Label: False
html:
Claim: Donating blood in the U.S. can get you a novel coronavirus test.

Explanation:The two organizations who collect the vast majority of blood in US said they were not testing for COVID-19

Claim: The WHO coronavirus test “was a bad test.”
Explaination: A review found the World Health Organization’s test did not give false positives when similar viruses were present. The White House provided no evidence that the WHO test fell short.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The WHO coronavirus test “was a bad test.”

Explanation:A review found the World Health Organization’s test did not give false positives when similar viruses were present. The White House provided no evidence that the WHO test fell short.

Claim: Because of the global quarantine, the WHO and the Ecuadorian government have given a weekly bonus to each family for food and medicine.
Explaination: The government is studying the possibility to apply a welfare amount for poor people during quarantine.
Label: False

Claim: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte was quoted in various posts and graphics on Facebook as saying they have “lost control” of the coronavirus pandemic that is greatly affecting Italy.
Explaination: No official statements or reports from credible news organizations carry this supposed quote by Conte. The graphics and screenshots also did not point to the source of the quote.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Italian Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte was quoted in various posts and graphics on Facebook as saying they have “lost control” of the coronavirus pandemic that is greatly affecting Italy.

Explanation:No official statements or reports from credible news organizations carry this supposed quote by Conte. The graphics and screenshots also did not point to the source of the quote.

Claim: WhatsApp group admins were detained for sharing coronavirus messages in Dadar, Mumbai.
Explaination: Mumbai Police spokesperson rubbished the claim that Mumbai police's cyber cell was registering cases against 52 WhatsApp group admins and called it fake.
Label: False
html:
Claim: WhatsApp group admins were detained for sharing coronavirus messages in Dadar, Mumbai.

Explanation:Mumbai Police spokesperson rubbished the claim that Mumbai police's cyber cell was registering cases against 52 WhatsApp group admins and called it fake.

Claim: A chain message circulated on Tuesday, Jan. 14, warning people to avoid going to Shangri-La Plaza (a mall in Mandaluyong City) because of a supposed case of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) reported in one of the mall’s medical clinics.
Explaination: The Department of Health (DOH) and Healthway Medical both issued advisories denying the claim in the chain message.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A chain message circulated on Tuesday, Jan. 14, warning people to avoid going to Shangri-La Plaza (a mall in Mandaluyong City) because of a supposed case of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) reported in one of the mall’s medical clinics.

Explanation:The Department of Health (DOH) and Healthway Medical both issued advisories denying the claim in the chain message.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/249371-sars-case-reported-clinic-shangri-la-plaza-mall

Claim: The viral image is of a doctor couple in Italy who gave their lives treating coronavirus patients.
Explaination: This photograph was taken in Barcelona airport, Spain. No such news report of the Italian doctor couple found.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: The viral image is of a doctor couple in Italy who gave their lives treating coronavirus patients.

Explanation:This photograph was taken in Barcelona airport, Spain. No such news report of the Italian doctor couple found.

Claim: “So Oscar Health, the company tapped by Trump to profit from covid tests, is a Kushner company. Imagine that, profits over national safety.”
Explaination: Oscar Health does have ties to the Kushner family through Jared Kushner and more directly through Jared’s brother, Joshua Kushner. Oscar Health created a website for finding coronavirus testing locations. The project was launched on the same day that Trump announced a similar partnership with Google.
Label: HALF TRUE
html:
Claim: “So Oscar Health, the company tapped by Trump to profit from covid tests, is a Kushner company. Imagine that, profits over national safety.”

Explanation:Oscar Health does have ties to the Kushner family through Jared Kushner and more directly through Jared’s brother, Joshua Kushner. Oscar Health created a website for finding coronavirus testing locations. The project was launched on the same day that Trump announced a similar partnership with Google.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/23/facebook-posts/what-kushner-linked-company-has-do-coronavirus-tes/

Claim: President Donald Trump will announce that a scientist “finally found a vaccine to cure coronavirus.”

Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: President Donald Trump will announce that a scientist “finally found a vaccine to cure coronavirus.”

Explanation:Trump has not announced a vaccine to prevent COVID-19. As of now, there is no specific treatment for the coronavirus.

Claim: An image has been shared multiple times on Facebook in Liberia in support of a claim that pastors were beaten for defying government restrictions on religious gatherings amid the novel coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: Although a police crackdown on churches took place, the use of the picture in this context is false as it was shot years ago at an unrelated event.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An image has been shared multiple times on Facebook in Liberia in support of a claim that pastors were beaten for defying government restrictions on religious gatherings amid the novel coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:Although a police crackdown on churches took place, the use of the picture in this context is false as it was shot years ago at an unrelated event.

https://factcheck.afp.com/afp-photo-shot-2006-during-unrelated-incident?fbclid=IwAR0qxNVUlcoJfxPGKcxtXbN8lTaRrlbhQ-sd2AkMflXk2jImP77n4GghvPk

Claim: An audio clip is circulating on Whatsapp claiming that Nagpur (Second Capital of Indian state Maharashtra) has tested 59 positive coronavirus cases including three doctors.
Explaination: We found that there are only 4 positive coronavirus cases in Nagpur. The district administration and Nagpur Municipal Corporation have denied such rumors. Divisional Commissioner of Nagpur said the administration would take stern action against such rumor mongers. We also spoke with Deputy Commissioner who informed the same.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An audio clip is circulating on Whatsapp claiming that Nagpur (Second Capital of Indian state Maharashtra) has tested 59 positive coronavirus cases including three doctors.

Explanation:We found that there are only 4 positive coronavirus cases in Nagpur. The district administration and Nagpur Municipal Corporation have denied such rumors. Divisional Commissioner of Nagpur said the administration would take stern action against such rumor mongers. We also spoke with Deputy Commissioner who informed the same.

https://marathi.factcrescendo.com/fake-audio-clip-goes-viral-about-coronavirus-situation-in-nagpur/
